reply.question: 1. Does the app declare the collection of data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the collection of data.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy specifically mentions the type of personal data collected and the purpose of data collection, indicating that the app declares the collection of data.
reply.reference: The type of personal data that Vault Platform may collect on the Business Customer’s behalf and the timing of when it may be shared with the Business Customer is explained in this section. URL: https://vaultplatform.com/product-privacy-statement
reply.section: Personal Data We Collect on The Business Customer’s Behalf

Personal Data We Collect on The Business Customer’s Behalf
The type of personal data that Vault Platform may collect on the Business Customer’s behalf and the timing of when it may be shared with the Business Customer is explained in this section.

reply.question: 2. If the app declares the collection of data, what type of data does it collect?

answer.full_answer: The app may collect data such as IP address, operating system type and version, device identifier, default language, browser type, screen resolution, general location information, metadata, and information about user interactions with the Services.

content: information about user interactions with the Services

reply.analysis: The answer is derived from the section that discusses the automated collection of information on the Services, including various types of data that may be gathered about the users.

URL: https://vaultplatform.com/product-privacy-statement

reply.question: 3. Does the app declare the purpose of data collection and use?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the purpose of data collection and use. The personal data collected is used to enable end users to report workplace misconduct, improve the Business Customer and user services, establish and maintain user profiles, communicate about the services, provide support, respond to requests, and comply with legal and regulatory requirements.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy document clearly outlines the purpose of data collection and use, indicating that the collected data is used for specific functions related to enabling users to report misconduct, improving services, and ensuring compliance with legal requirements.
reply.reference: The personal data collected is used to provide the Services and for related internal purposes, including to enable End Users to report workplace misconduct; improve the Business Customer and your Services; establish and maintain your user profile on the Services; communicate with you about the Services, including by sending you announcements, updates, new features, security alerts, and support and administrative messages; provide support and maintenance for the Services; and respond to your requests, questions and feedback. URL: https://vaultplatform.com/product-privacy-statement

reply.question: 4. Can the user opt out of data collection or delete data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the user can opt out of data collection or request deletion of data by submitting Data Subject Requests to the Business Customer, who will then cooperate with Vault Platform.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy states that the user can request to exercise their rights to opt out of data collection or request deletion of data by contacting the Business Customer, who will manage these requests with Vault Platform as per the contractual arrangements.
reply.reference: As the Business Customer is the data controller in respect of the personal data that we hold about you and process as part of the Services, the Business Customer is primarily responsible for receiving and responding to your requests to exercise any rights afforded to you under applicable data protection laws, including in respect of the removal of your personal data ('Data Subject Requests'). We will cooperate with the Business Customer in respect of your Data Subject Requests in accordance with our contractual arrangements with the Business Customer. URL: https://vaultplatform.com/product-privacy-statement

reply.question: 5. Does the app share data with third parties?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app may share data with specific entities and individuals as permitted by the Business Customer, including corporate affiliates, service providers for hosting and analytics, and government or law enforcement officials when required by law.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy states that the app may share personal data with certain entities and individuals in accordance with agreements with the Business Customer or if required by law.
reply.reference: We do not share your personal data with third parties other than in accordance with the agreement with the Business Customer or if required to be disclosed by law... We may share your personal data with the following entities and individuals as permitted by the Business Customer... Vault Platform’s corporate affiliates and subsidiaries; Vault Platform’s service providers that help or enable us to provide the Services... government, law enforcement officials or private parties as required by law... URL: https://vaultplatform.com/product-privacy-statement
